description:
This module examines the idol phenomenon in Japan
and Korea through an interdisciplinary approach. The
module will introduce students to key concepts in the
study of idols and celebrities, and address the
production, representation, circulation and
consumption of idols and celebrities in contemporary
Japan and Korea (and beyond) within their historical,
social, political and economic contexts. By the end of
the module, students will not only gain a deeper
understanding of Japanese and Korean society, they
will also gain conceptual and analytical tools for
understanding todayâ€™s global media landscape.
title: Idols and Celebrities in Japan and Korea
